titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Hugh Byas papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Manuscripts and Archives Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 08:26

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: Scrapbooks, writings and research files on 11 reels of microfilm (HM 95). The research files consist of pamphlets, periodicals, newspaper clippings and news bulletins on all aspects of Japanese life which were compiled for lectures at Yale University, 1941-1945, and for use in a book which was never published. The scrapbooks contain clippings of his articles which appeared in The Times (London), The New York Times and The Japan Times and Mail , 1928-1939. Also a small number of drafts of articles written between 1932 and 1939.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Hugh Byas Papers (HM 95). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Scrapbooks, writings and research files on 11 reels of microfilm (HM 95). The research files consist of pamphlets, periodicals, newspaper clippings and news bulletins on all aspects of Japanese life which were compiled for lectures at Yale University, 1941-1945, and for use in a book which was never published. The scrapbooks contain clippings of his articles which appeared in The Times (London) , The New York Times and The Japan Times and Mail , 1928-1939. Also a small number of drafts of articles written between 1932 and 1939. Originals were discarded after filming.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown, though much of the material in this collection is likely in the public domain. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Newspaper correspondent. Scrapbooks, writings and research files. The latter, consisting of pamphlets, periodicals, newspaper clippings and news bulletins on all aspects of Japanese life were compiled for lectures at Yale University, 1941-1945, and for use in a book which was never published. The scrapbooks contain clippings of his articles which appeared in The Times (London), The New York Times and The Japan Times and Mail , 1928-1939. Also a small number of drafts of articles written between 1932 and 1939.
Microfilm, New Haven, Yale University Library, 1980.

did.unittitle: Press regulations and military secrets, laws
Tanaka Memorial; Fifth Column; Miscellaneous Notes
